General course objectives:
General course objectives
The main objective is to give the students the practical competences to perform cell line development, cultivation of mammalian cells for protein expression and production in the context of industrial biopharmaceutical production.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Retrieve and thaw mammalian cells from a cell bank.
Establish and run a seed train.
Transfect mammalian cells.
Establish a clonal host cell line.
Set up and conduct bioreactor cultivations of mammalian clonal cell cultures .
Perform a chromatographic purification of proteins from a bioreactor run.
Collect and analyze cultivation data from bioreactor run of mammalian cell cultures producing biopharmaceutical proteins.
Perform standard characterization of purified protein.
Discuss strategies for improving biopharmaceutical protein production based on cultivation data.
Discuss the use of different types of reactors and analytical equipment used in mammalian bioprocess.
Content:
Biotechnological methods and techniques applied in the context of mammalian cell cultures.
A technical understanding of bioreactors for mammalian cell cultures.
Applied understanding of the selection and development process of clonal mammalian cell lines.
Protein purification and analytical methods for quality assessment of pharmaceutical proteins.
Cultivation physiology and process optimization.
Learn about different cultivation methods such as batch, fed-batch and continuous cultivation.
Remarks:
This course is mainly offered to MSc Biotechnology and MSc Pharmaceutical Design and
Engineering students.
